greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of endofunctions f on [n] such that f^n(i) = f(i) for all i in [n].
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..150
formula: a(n) = n! * [x^n] exp(Sum_{d|(n-1)} (x*exp(x))^d/d) for n>1, a(0)=a(1)=1.
maple: exp(add((x*exp(x))^d/d, d=divisors(n-1))), x, n+1), x, n)):
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 24 2014
